regular-body:
anri-du-toit:

my first year of grad school is officially over, and i have survived it, and i am mangled but by no means destroyed, so, hooray

today it is raining, that slow soft colorado rain where the sky is still half-clear and the other half is dark and close and the thunder comes from very far off and it sounds like stampedes

i am in the lab, i am always in the lab, i am tying tags onto the right hind feet of kangaroo mice and dormice and house mice, i am reading pet sematary which is maybe not the best idea surrounded by dead animals, but.

i am feeling okay again, i think. i said mangled earlier, and i meant it, i feel like i have been through a physical wringer, i feel like something with sharp metal teeth has been at me for some time, but these things pass, and it is passing, and even if it doesnât, well. i have gotten this far.

this weekend i am driving to my parentsâ house to surprise my mom for motherâs day, which is the sort of gesture i like to make, and i like to drive, and i need a vacation. if you have music recommendations, or you are bored and you want to make me a mixtape (a playlist, whatever, i will always call them mixtapes), please do that, sparrowsays @ gmail. i will appreciate it, i will someday return the favor, i will send you sugar in the mail, i will write your name on my wrists, i will listen.

My friend anri sure does write well, doesn’t she?
